title: Perfect Avocado Toast
description: A simple yet delicious breakfast or brunch option with creamy avocado, perfectly seasoned, on crispy toasted bread. Customizable with your favorite toppings!

instructions.text: Toast the bread slices until golden brown and crispy.
While bread is toasting, cut avocados in half, remove pit, and scoop flesh into a bowl.
Mash avocados with a fork, leaving some chunks for texture. Add lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
Spread the avocado mixture generously on each toasted bread slice.
Top with cherry tomatoes, poached eggs, microgreens, and a sprinkle of red pepper flakes as desired.
Serve immediately while toast is still warm. Enjoy!

notes: Choose ripe but firm avocados for the best texture - they should yield slightly to gentle pressure.
Add a drizzle of hot sauce or sriracha for an extra kick.
For a vegan version, skip the poached egg and add extra toppings like hemp seeds or nutritional yeast.
Toast the bread until it's crispy to prevent it from getting soggy.

faqs.question: How do I know if my avocado is ripe?
faqs.answer: A ripe avocado should yield to gentle pressure but not feel mushy. The skin may be dark green to nearly black, and it should come away from the pit easily.

faqs.question: Can I make this ahead?
faqs.answer: It's best enjoyed fresh, but you can mash the avocado with lemon juice up to 2 hours ahead. Keep covered with plastic wrap pressed directly on the surface to prevent browning.

faqs.question: What other toppings work well?
faqs.answer: Try feta cheese, smoked salmon, radish slices, everything bagel seasoning, or a drizzle of balsamic glaze.
